page.title: 19Ecology-The Dykes-Dymchurch
page.content: The dykes on The Marsh are used for draining the fields.The dykes carry water to the sea.The water is rich with plants,bugs & fish.There are many different kinds of fish such as eels, rudd,minnows & sticklebacks.These are some of the plants:bulrush,curled pond -weed,marsh marigolds,pink-flowering rush,small duckweed,thick-leaved duck- weed,water violet,yellow iris,water moss,reed mace,horsetail,water mint & watercress.Birds live in the dykes too:mallard,coot,mute swan,tern,king- fisher,moorhen & heron.There are snails like the great pond snail & marsh snail.There are lots of water beetles,fresh-water shrimps,pond skaters,water boatmen,great diving beetles,water fleas & gnat larvae.Dyke insects include the common damselfly, common grasshopper and the large red damselfly.
